Baboons

Robert Sapolsky has spent much of his life studying Baboon society. While Baboons are not human, they, along with other higher primates, share with humans the ability to be stressed out. Like many of us, these primates don’t spend most of the day worrying about their next meal, and so like many of us, they are prey to mental stress. “Baboon ...

War Stress

In Iraq, counselors are helping U.S. soldiers develop coping skills so that they can handle the stress of combat. But doctors are finding growing anxiety among Iraqi people who see themselves as caught in a helpless situation. NPR’s Emily Harris reports.
